subject: run and runTest
msgSnippet: Hello all, I m thoroughly confused. I m trying to wrap an existing test harness program with JUnit, so I don t expect having testThis() and testThat() methods.
messageBody:
Hello all,

I'm thoroughly confused.
I'm trying to wrap an existing test harness program with JUnit,
so I don't expect having testThis() and testThat() methods.

So, it seemed logical for me to override run() or runTest().
I would then invoke my tool which iterates through a number of data driven tests.
However, whenever I did so, I get message "No tests found in HelloWorld"
and none of my overridden methods are called. Not very friendly.

Then, somewhat by accident, I ran the same code with a single blank test included ( testB() )
and then the test runner finally invoked all my overridden methods.

Is this expected behavior?
I can fudge things by invoking my test tool from inside testB(),
but then all my gazillion tests are represented by a single test.

Any suggestions?

Thanks,

Erik Ostermueller

import junit.framework.TestResult;
import junit.framework.TestSuite;
import junit.framework.TestCase;
import junit.framework.Test;
public class HelloWorld extends TestCase {

//Comment in this line to see all the println stuff.
//Leave this line comment out to get error "No tests found in HelloWorld"
// public void testB(){}

public HelloWorld(String strTestId) {
super(strTestId);
}
public TestResult run() {
System.out.println("Hello from run");
TestResult tr = createResult();
return tr;
}
public void run(TestResult tr) {
System.out.println("Hello from public void run(TestResult tr)");
doTest();
}
protected void runTest() throws java.lang.Throwable {
System.out.println("Hello from runTest");
doTest();
}


public void doTest() {
System.out.println("Hello from doTest");
}
}
